Content

  • This module contains compendia with monsters, powers, feats, magic items, etc.

  • Monsters are split into two compendia: Monster Manual 3 (MM3) and earlier monsters (Legacy).

  • Magic item powers are in the Powers (Items) compendium.

  • Powers have attack and damage rolls built-in, but do not transfer effects.

  • Feats do not add bonuses automatically. If you want this, you need to create active effects. See the Foundry 4e System manual for reference.

Character Import

  • Import characters from the DDI Character Builder by using the Import Character from CBuilder button in the Actors tab.

  • This currently only supports the import of things included in this module (no homebrew yet, sorry).

Magic Item Builder

  • Construct a magic items, for example a Battering Craghammer +3, by using the Build Magic Item button in the Items tab.

Monster Level Adjustment

  • Right-click a monster in the Actors tab and choose Adjust Monster Level to cast it to a new level.

  • This tool also works for folders of monsters, which can help you adjust an entire encounter.

Monster Math Fixes

  • In the Actors tab, right-click an old monster from before Monster Manual 3 and select Apply MM3 Math Fixes. This will update its statistics to the newest monster math.

  • This also works for folders of monsters.

  • Watch out! Applying the fixes to MM3 monsters will mess up their math.

Monster Reskinning

  • In the Actors tab, right-click a monster and select Find and Replace to reskin its name and powers.

Encounter Building Summary

  • Show the encounter difficulty for a group of selected monster tokens by pressing Shift + G.

  • Change the hotkey in the Configure Controls menu.

Temporary Effects Summary

  • Post the temporary effects of selected tokens by pressing Shift + Q.

  • Enable automated posting at the start of every combat turn in the module settings.

  • Change the hotkey in the Configure Controls menu.

Hit Point Messages

  • Enable automated posting of HP changes in the module settings.
